channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @JustSomeJoo @EladNehorai Yes. This despite the fact that the Talmud famously equates hurting someone’s feelings with murder.

@CaitlinWolper Why not? Regina is a known quantity. The new album is either a radical departure (unlikely) or continued growth and evolution (more likely) or just a dismal disappointment (also unlikely) but it’s a story nonetheless.
@yumcoconutmilk Looks like unless you already have low blood pressure problems, a normal dose shouldn’t result in anything worse than a headache and might deliver benefits. https://t.co/yAvb7zgEqL
@trekonomics Good thing the oligarchs have diversified into Swiss bank accounts and luxury apartments!
Evergreen tweet. https://t.co/tiAw8H6EPe
@JustSayXtian @Delafina777 And of course “lestai” is incorporated into Talmudic Aramaic a few centuries later….
@rmneiss Not going to listen, but possibly related: https://t.co/cJHQfUeDq3
@yonatanb @Marriott @gallifreyone @shaunlyon Didn’t know that cat scans were now part of the protocol.
@ani_kokobobo @bogiperson @nytimes The New York Times doesn’t believe in taking sides. Taking sides might offend Republicans, so there’s a serious financial downside.

Your occasional reminder that during her stint at the Forward, this champion of the “working class” never reached out to the @JewishLaborComm for suggestions of authors who might bring the concerns of the working class to Forward readers. https://t.co/Q0xpiRemJC
Sad if true. https://t.co/AYmbRpcZHY
@sarahthemoose I’m very grateful that my mother recorded a 90 minute interview with her about all sorts of things, including the assassination of President William McKinley in 1901.

@sarahthemoose I was born in 1964. My great grandmother was born in 1878. My last visit with her was in 1979. She came to our house, and I showed her my Apple computer. “If I were a little younger, I’d have to learn all about this,” she said.
So I guess it wasn’t all in vain. https://t.co/CRjd8IuPCI

@trekonomics I suspect they were fools already. It seems to me that at no time did the virus act worse than a mildly pessimistic projection would indicate — say, a 25% scenario. And with health and lives at stake, inexcusable not to recommend mild pessimism.

@dzkalman I suspect the Israeli laws on such matters are far less favorable to celebrity heirs than those of California. (I think this is a matter of state rather than federal law.)
@dzkalman Quite probable that the failure of Chabad to license a gazillion Rebbe pictures would make it difficult to go after knockoffs.
Speaking of Jews.... https://t.co/p1F3vwQrtR
@datadivajf The secret origin of Professor Wogglebug of Oz.
Hard to believe the Democratic millionaire class who run the party would scapegoat women of color…. https://t.co/GDGpGP7W4H
This is why the radical Christian fundamentalists who have taken over the Republican Party want to stop government services and have them provided by "private" charity. https://t.co/bi8V7pOCaJ
@touchthesun @TheAmazingMcWil @doctorow @remembrancermx Can't believe I didn't know about this. You can find it here: https://t.co/39ZFT4n4zU
@dzkalman You call that old? I was on the AECOM bang path as a YU CS major.
@jamesdnicoll Shoulder mounted RPGs or go home.
@jr_foust @Atrios Which makes it criminally negligent the Democratic leadership isn’t trying to demonize all Republicans as fanatic anti-vaxxers.
